It was decent anime after dropping it before i decided to re-watch it again and after several episodes i began to enjoy it. 
There were a few things that could have made it more enjoyable for me like a bit of romance and maybe more of life after all the battles were over but that's a personal thing i guess. If your looking for decent anime to watch i'd recommend it.
If you like battle anime you will probably like this it's tournament based and has a pretty good concept to it which is fairly unique in terms of how they get powers and what thepowers do compared to other super power anime. 


It's a bit like yu yu hakusho in term of the tournament element although the tournament itself is a bit different in the fact it's not a fixed location and the characters can be getting on with there daily lives while competing at least for the first half of the anime so if you enjoyed that you you will probably enjoy this.

The law of ueki is a great anime. It's not revolutionary or anything and the story is basic but i enjoyed it. To say the truth i was sceptical at first because of it's length. I know 51 episodes isn't a huge number of episodes but i only watched anime with 12-26 episodes so the law of ueki wasn't in my top interests. Now i am happy that i watched it.
(story) The story is about a kid called Ueki Kousuke. An normal high schooler that is picked by a god candicate? What is that? Well as the name says it's a candicate for a godand each candicate has to pick a highschool kid to fight for them. Ueki is one of those kids. Thankfully he is given a power to defend himself. What is that power you ask? Well he can change garbage to.........trees. Not and the most helpful power but ok. It's still better than nothing i suppose. Now ueki has to fight other highschoolers for his god candicate to become a god.


As i said the story isn't anything special. It's typical stuff and isn't really tempting, but the anime shines on other factors.


(Characters) The characters is the best thingh about this anime. When a new character is introduced, it always has some characteristics about the. For example their class and what kind of food they like. The main character Ueki is also a common highschooler that eats a lot and doesn't care about anything to such an extent that it is funny. The friends he meet along the way are also amusing and funny at some parts, but since i don't want to spoil it i won't be mentioning them. 


(visuals) Visually it is great, as every anime should. It's colors are lively but it's like every other anime as i said.


(Sound) Sound based it's good but again the same as ever. It's the common Sound effects but it has a fairly good soundtrack and 2 amazing opening songs. I listen to the opening songs almost every day.


(enjoyment) The law of ueki is a funny anime with a lot of fighting, a lot of weird and unusual powers and a little bit of drama here and there.


I recommend you watch it if you have some free time and you don't get bored of an anime quickly.

I swear i will never forget about this anime.
It is one of my favorite animes ever, i really enjoyed the story, it has a great comedy & action. 
I liked basically all of the characters, especially the main one (Ueki Kosuke) I think people can learn alot from him.
& to mention that the story from this anime tells how important friendship is.

While scavenging the web for something to nourish my hunger for action oriented anime, I came across this little refreshment and picked it up. It’s a shounen anime. Awesome! So what can the MC do? Turn trash into trees. Cool! Wait, what? He can turn trash….into….trees?! Yep, didn’t read that wrong. 
This is the first thing Law of Ueki hits you with. But albeit a weak start, the anime truly develops brilliantly. It’s one of those anime which are either under-appreciated or forgotten. It’s got a clichéd story (perhaps?), clichéd characters, clichéd mc, clichéd concept yet non clichéd powers, excellent fights and outright comedy. It’sabout time to expand upon those features.


-------------Story-------------


The story is pretty generic. The formula of including tournaments in battle shounen to declare a winner, popularized by Dragon Ball, found its way into countless shounen that followed; Law of Ueki is no exception. However, the execution here is done excellently. It’s not just fighting out in an arena confined within large stands for viewers. Anyplace can become the battleground.

The plot is that the celestial king, a Godlike mortal being, has to choose his successor, so instead of picking someone at random he chooses 100 king candidates, each of whom can choose a middle schooler human representative, give him/her a unique power and let them battle it out. The candidate whose representative wins will be the next king and the representative will receive the “Talent of Blank”, that is to say, any one talent s/he may desire. All power users have talents and whenever they use their power to hurt non-power users, one of their talents are gone; a person with zero talent ceases to exist and vanishes without a trace. Little do they know there are beings other than humans taking part in the battle. As the story progresses it starts to become a bit more interesting, and though somewhere halfway down the road it kinda becomes like a typical shounen tournament, the fights, which are what shounen are pretty much about, more than makes up for it. Aside from the serious plot, there’s a lot of comedy in this series as well and they can make you laugh like an idiot; though that primarily depends on an individual’s sense of humor. One more thing, don’t expect any romance in this one. That factor is next to non-existent in this anime. But all in all, the plot is good and well executed.


-------------Sound-------------


The music is great and complements the story well. The OST’s really gets you pumped up in certain situations and of course in the fights. The voice actors did a very good job on their roles as well; I’m talking about the dub by the way. The openings and endings are standard J-Pop tracks which are nice; just don’t expect any “Unravel” or “Brave Shine” in this one, and you’ll be fine.


-------------Art/Animation-------------


Keep in mind that this is an anime from 2005. Judging by that the animation/art style is very well done. It doesn’t have overwhelmingly eye popping visuals like Fate/Stay Night UBW, but neither is it an anime you can’t watch without your eyes bleeding. Given the timeframe, it’s really pretty decent.


-------------Characters-------------


Aaahh, now this is where Law of Ueki truly shines. The large cast of characters in the show are almost all likeable characters. Take our hero Ueki for example – he appears as hollow and empty at the beginning of the series, but as the story progresses his character becomes more and more appreciable. With a strong sense of “righteousness”, he’ll throw himself to help just about anyone, friends, strangers, even enemies. Starting from zero, Ueki not only masters his potential but also learns to use them in a variety of cunning way. His battle ingenuity becomes more and more apparent and at times you can’t refrain from saying “brilliant!!”……. unless you’ve watched about 300 anime and nothing surprises you anymore, but that’s an exception I suppose (and it probably means you’ve seen this one already). And then we have Ai Mori who starts out as a straight-man comic relief but eventually becomes a much more important main character. Every character has substantial developments and great backstories, backstories that may seem foolish and childish but given most of them being experienced as a child, they hold up in a great manner. Protagonists, supporting characters, antagonists, and even the Celestial King has nice backstories which allow us to understand and sympathize with them. However the one bad thing about them is all the protagonists tend to use overly cheesy dialogues regarding “friendship” and “fighting for others”; and this is true whether you’re watching the subs or listening to the dubs. The portrayal of “righteousness” is strong with this one, a little too strong. Dialogues that remind you of “fairy tail” at times. It’s about the only thing that annoyed me quite a bit. Nevertheless, in the end you end up liking most, if not all, of the characters shown in the series.


-------------Fights and powers-------------


This isn’t a section typically included in a review but I think this anime needs one anyway. There is a wide variety of unique powers in this anime, powers that can come off as really strange. Other than the MC’s unique power, there’s the power to change towels into Iron and power to shift your voice through portraits etc. Bottom-line, they are unique and there are a lot of them; kinda reminds of “One Piece” in a way. However, there is a limiting condition to all the powers; meaning they can be used only if certain conditions are met.


As to the fights, they…are….awesome! Trust me, the fight scenes are excellently done, and they’re not just mindless battles. A lot of cunning, strategies, and on-spot tactics are present throughout the numerous fight scenes. No, there’s no Hi-def slow-motion sword-fights in this one but seriously, that’s not something you should even expect from Law of Ueki. And the predictability is somewhat less than your average shounen anime. There are times when you think something’s gonna happen now, but it doesn’t. Instead something happens unexpectedly later on, when you’re not expecting it anymore. In any case, the fights truly live up to the expectations concerning a shounen.


------------- Overall: 7.5+/10 -------------


Law of Ueki is a splendid shounen; the creativity behind the battles are what makes it even more enjoyable. Ueki, or anyone else in this anime for that matter, is no Natsu Dragneel who gets up, wipes his mouth and says “I’m gonna kick your ass”, and then wins. No, it’s not that simple. There are a lot of thoughts behind those fights. I would’ve actually given it an 8 but those overly cheesy dialogues kinda made me tone down my scoring. Then again, a 7 would never justify this show as it would be unfairly low rating; even 7.5 might not cut it, hence the plus. As a fractional score can't be given here on MAL, I chose an 8 nevertheless. It’s an anime I would definitely recommend to any shounen lovers.
